item.title: The drain on the A40 to the East of Woodgate Close does nothing as it is too high to collect all the water from the fields. The A40 was resurfaced which was great but this drain was not altered. It cannot cope when it rains or with the aftermarth from the fields., 7th January
item.description:
The drain is at the bottom of the public footpath between the Charlton Kings hotel and Woodgate Close. On the A40 as you drive from Andoversford into Cheltenham.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Woodgate Close, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: State of public toilets, 7th January
item.description:
For over 2 years the public toilet condition has become progressively worse. Requires refurbishment and more regular cleaning. They generally stink, and generally require modernisation. They are right in the centre of a park used by thousands of people, young and old, and are not fit for a public park as historic as Pittville Park
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Pittville Crescent Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pittville Crescent Lane, 7th January
item.description:
Entire Pittville Crescent Lane requires cleaning of mud, leaves and weeds Also note a sunken drain cover, not level with the road. Treacherous at night as can't be seen. Approx 50m from the T junction in Pittville Crescent Lane, in direction of Albert Road towards centre of town ( not in direction of Pittville Park)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, Pittville Crescent Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
